neighbors.name: Seth & Rachel Barrier
neighbors.claims: Seth and Rachel Barrier own property in the Cloverdale area of Putnam County, part of the 2,000-acre zone proposed for a utility-scale solar farm ([www.giant.fm](https://www.giant.fm/putnam-county/news/local-news/putnam-county-plan-commission-to-take-up-solar-farm-rezoning/#:~:text=The%20meeting%2C%20which%20is%20slated,ask%20questions%20of%20the%20petitioner)). During 2025 hearings on the project, county officials reported that hundreds of locals (386 people in letters) were against the solar development versus only 25 in favor ([terrehautevice.com](https://terrehautevice.com/2025/10/07/putnam-says-no-residents-commissioners-reject-2000-acre-solar-proposal/#:~:text=During%20that%20meeting%2C%20County%20Plan,lacked%20transparency%20and%20sufficient%20studies)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Local farmland owners; no public office

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a trusted local farm leader speak with the Barriers about how land stewardship and property values will be protected, highlighting long-term farmland preservation measures.

neighbors.name: Eric B. Kaufman
neighbors.claims: Eric B. Kaufman is listed as a landowner in rural Putnam County within the area where a 300 MW solar project (the 4Leaf Solar Farm) was proposed in 2025 ([www.giant.fm](https://www.giant.fm/putnam-county/news/local-news/putnam-county-plan-commission-to-take-up-solar-farm-rezoning/#:~:text=The%20meeting%2C%20which%20is%20slated,ask%20questions%20of%20the%20petitioner)). No public statements from Kaufman on the project were found, but the broader community response was overwhelmingly negative (only 25 supporters versus 386 opponents in submitted letters) ([terrehautevice.com](https://terrehautevice.com/2025/10/07/putnam-says-no-residents-commissioners-reject-2000-acre-solar-proposal/#:~:text=During%20that%20meeting%2C%20County%20Plan,lacked%20transparency%20and%20sufficient%20studies)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Address his practical concerns directly – for example, explain drainage plans and road use limits – through a personal visit by a project engineer alongside a respected neighbor to build confidence.

neighbors.name: Nathan D. & Katrina M. Skirvin
neighbors.claims: Katrina “Kate” Skirvin is a veteran agriculture teacher at North Putnam High School who received a 2022 national award as an Outstanding Agricultural Educator ([www.nputnam.k12.in.us](https://www.nputnam.k12.in.us/o/nputnamin/article/930908#:~:text=LAS%20VEGAS%2C%20Nevada%20%E2%80%93%20Kate,December%203%2C%20in%20Las%20Vegas)) ([www.nputnam.k12.in.us](https://www.nputnam.k12.in.us/o/nputnamin/article/930908#:~:text=agriculture%20experiences%20for%20students%20with,can%20be%20successful%20and%20accepted)). She has emerged as a local voice for farmland preservation – in January 2025, Skirvin presented on the risks of industrial solar projects to Putnam County’s agricultural land at a community forum organized by a rural preservation group ([pcrps.carrd.co](https://pcrps.carrd.co/#:~:text=,Solar%20Projects%3B%20Education%20and%20Risks)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage her with peer experts in agriculture – for example, invite an agricultural extension specialist to discuss how the solar farm can co-exist with farming and protect land for future generations.

neighbors.name: J. B. Michael
neighbors.claims: J. B. Michael (name as listed in county records) owns land in the southern part of Putnam County in the vicinity of the proposed 4Leaf solar project ([www.giant.fm](https://www.giant.fm/putnam-county/news/local-news/putnam-county-plan-commission-to-take-up-solar-farm-rezoning/#:~:text=The%20meeting%2C%20which%20is%20slated,ask%20questions%20of%20the%20petitioner)). He has no documented public comments on local development issues; community input on the solar farm was dominated by other residents, with hundreds voicing concerns about noise, fencing, and loss of rural scenery ([www.giant.fm](https://www.giant.fm/putnam-county/news/local-news/putnam-county-plan-commission-to-take-up-solar-farm-rezoning/#:~:text=Fidler%20said%20she%20has%20several,students%20due%20to%20families%20moving)).
neighbors.influence_justification: No known civic role; private individual

approach_recommendations.engage: Emphasize measures to preserve the quiet, scenic nature of his surroundings – for example, via visual buffers and noise minimization – delivered in a personal conversation by a neighbor he trusts who supports the project.

overview_summary: All four profiled neighbors are private landowners near the proposed 4Leaf solar project site, and none has been documented publicly supporting the development. At least one (Skirvin) has actively opposed it, and the others have not expressed support. One neighbor (Skirvin) is a high-influence community member due to her leadership in agricultural education and local advocacy; the rest appear to have low public profiles and influence.
